name: African Elephant
fact: The African elephant is the largest land animal. Their trunks have over 40,000 muscles.
danger: Generally peaceful, but protective mothers can be aggressive.

name: Peregrine Falcon
fact: Peregrine falcons are the fastest birds, reaching over 200 mph during dives.

name: Blue Whale
fact: The blue whale is the largest animal known to have ever existed.
danger: No direct danger to humans but massive size.

name: Monarch Butterfly
fact: Monarchs migrate thousands of miles between North America and Mexico.
danger: Non-threatening; indicator species for ecosystem health.

name: Green Sea Turtle
fact: They return to the same beaches where they were born to lay eggs.
danger: Protected — disturbing nesting sites harms populations.

name: King Cobra
fact: King cobras can 'stand up' and look a human in the eye — they are the longest venomous snake.

name: Poison Dart Frog
fact: Their bright colors warn predators of their toxicity.
danger: Highly toxic in the wild — do not handle.

name: Giant Anteater
fact: Anteaters use their long sticky tongues to eat up to 30,000 insects a day.
danger: Can be aggressive if cornered; sharp claws.
